sec.p: Ruthenium(II) picolinate complex, Ru(pic), successfully functioned as a redox photosensitizer with a much wider wavelength range of visible-light absorption (λ abs < 670 nm) compared with a fairly typical Ru(dmb) (λ abs < 560 nm). The system using Ru(pic) as a photosensitizer and Re as a catalyst photocatalyzed the reduction of CO 2 to CO by red-light irradiation (λ ex > 620 nm). TON CO reached 235 and Φ CO was 8.0%. Even in the irradiation conditions where Ru(dmb) also absorbed light, i.e., λ ex > 500 nm, the system using Ru(pic) demonstrated faster CO formation (TOF CO = 6.7 min −1) and larger TON CO (2347) than that using Ru(dmb) (TOF CO = 3.6 min −1, TON CO = 2100).
